entry.title: How to get Underseaweed in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
While adventuring through the Mines in Fields of Mistria, you’ll come across a variety of forageable items. Among these items is Underseaweed, which you’re going to need for a variety of reasons.
How to get Underseaweed in Fields of Mistria
Screenshot by Destructoid
Before you can get some Underseaweed, you’ll need to do a couple of things:
Unlock the Mines and reach floor 20
Break through the Water Seal to get to floor 21
Once you’ve done these two things, you’ll have access to Tide Caverns, which make up floors 21 to 40 of the Mines. Down here, you’ll be able to get Underseaweed, which is a green leafy plant that can be found in the water pools on these levels.
How to use Underseaweed in Fields of Mistria
Screenshot by Destructoid
Underseaweed is, first and foremost, an item which should be donated to the Museum as part of the Tide Caverns collection in the Flora Wing. After you’ve done this, you’ll unlock a unique conversational moment with Terithia.
Secondly, you should keep some Underseaweed as a gift for Valen. While her loved gifts mostly consist of meals which require multiple ingredients, Underseaweed is one of her liked gifts, so is an easy option if you’re trying to get more hearts with her.
Other than these two primary uses, you can also use Underseaweed in the following recipes, which you’ll unlock upon shipping one of the ingredients included in the recipe:
Meal Recipe Cooking time Cooking level

entry.title: How to get into the 2XKO Alpha Lab Test
entry.summary:
Riot Games has begun inviting players to participate in its 2XKO Alpha Lab test. If you're interested and want to join the action, here's how you can secure your spot in the test.
How to join the 2XKO Alpha Lab
For now, there are only two methods to join the ongoing 2XKO Alpha Lab test, and unfortunately, both rely on a degree of luck.
Receive an Invitation
The simplest way is to have Riot Games directly invite you. To be considered, though, you must have a Riot Account and sign up for the test on the official 2XKO website, if you haven't already. Make sure your account is using a verified e-mail, otherwise you won't be able to complete the next step.
Image via Riot Games
Once you register for the 2XKO Alpha Lab test, you'll receive an interest survey in the e-mail you used. This survey must be completed to be considered for the test. When you're done, the final step is to wait for Riot to invite you. Should you receive an invite, it will also come in the registered e-mail, providing you the opportunity to choose your preferred platform to participate.
Recieve a Friend Referral
The other way you can join the 2XKO test is by friend referral. Some of those who were invited to the 2XKO test also received a referral invite they could use to bring someone else into the test. If one of these players sends you a referral, you can play in the 2XKO Alpha Lab test without a Riot invitation. To be clear, this referral is not a key. It is a literal link you must click on. Only those with a Riot Account can use it to download and play in the test.
Unfortunately, there are no other known methods for joining the 2XKO Alpha Lab test, so you'll probably need to wait for an invite from Riot to get a chance to play it. The Alpha Lab test officially began on August 8 and will run until August 19. Currently, the test is only available on Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and Windows PC.

entry.title: When is the next Valorant Night Market?
entry.summary:
Through Valorant Night Market, you can get certain cosmetics or even melee weapons for a discounted price. We have the dates for Episode 9 Act 1, and here's everything you need to know.
Night Market arrives towards the end of every Valorant Act and is the ideal time to get your favorite skins. Although luck plays a major role in what skins you actually get as the drops are Random Number Generator-based (RNG), which means it's totally random.
Next Valorant Night Market date and schedule
The next Valorant Night Market (for Episode 9 Act 1) will commence on August 15 and ends on August 28, 2024. The current Act also ends on the same day.
Historically, they have gone live at 8 PM ET / 2 AM CET / 1 AM BST / 5:30 AM IST, and you can expect it to be the same this time around. This gives you 13 days in total to get your desired skins at a discounted price.
How many skins do you get and can you reroll them?
You get six skins for different weapons in total, and the discounts range from 10% to 49%. As we mentioned earlier, the occurrences are completely random.
You also can't reroll these skins and will remain the same as long as the Market is live for this Act. So, in case you didn't get your desired cosmetics this time, unfortunately, you'll need to wait for the next one to arrive with the hope of better skins.
When was the first Night Market in Valorant?
The first Night Market took place when Episode 1 Act 3 went live, back in December 2020. The one we are getting in Episode 9 Act 1 will be the 23rd iteration of the Night Market in the game.

entry.title: How to catch Pond Skater in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
If you've been trotting around the lands of Mistria, you've likely stumbled across a peculiar insect inside the water. Then, once you try to approach it, the bug hastily runs away to avoid you at all costs. It's tricky to do, but fortunately, a specific technique can guarantee its capture. So, let's dive into how to catch Pond Skater in Fields of Mistria.
How to get Pond Skater in Fields of Mistria
To get Pond Skater in Fields of Mistria, stand by the water's edge and patiently wait for it to come to you. No matter how many times you attempt to approach, the insect will always scuttle away when too near. Therefore, it's best to remain in the same spot, where it will eventually come to you.
Screenshot by Destructoid
The first Pond Skater I caught bounced around like a maniac for a minute or so until it finally got close enough for the capture. Though, it's easier said than done, considering that you must time your bug net swing at the opportune moment. Don't worry if you miss it the first time or even the second time around. The process takes a while to master, but it should eventually work in your favor.
Be aware that the Pond Skater is not present during the Winter season. Luckily, it can be found during all the other seasons, providing you with ample time to practice and prepare for its capture.
There's not a whole lot you can do with the Pond Skater in Fields of Mistria. The insect won't be needed for museum donations, nor does it sell for much profit (only 15 T). However, it does come up as a villager's request for extra Tesserae and gifts.

Thankfully, it's stripped of any actual fashy or genocidal play-acting beyond each side doing "hail the empire/union" bits as a sign off. entry.title: AMD Ryzen 5 9600X & Ryzen 7 9700X Offer Excellent Linux Performance
entry.summary: This could quite well be my simplest review in the past twenty years of Phoronix. The AMD Ryzen 9000 series starting with the Ryzen 5 9600X and Ryzen 7 9700X launching tomorrow are some truly great desktop processors. The generational uplift is very compelling, even in single-threaded Linux workloads shooting ahead of Intel's 14th Gen Core competition, across nearly 400 benchmarks these new Zen 5 desktop CPUs impress, and these new Zen 5 desktop processors are priced competitively. I was already loving the Ryzen 7000 series performance on Linux with its AVX-512 implementation and performing so well across hundreds of different Linux workloads but now with the AMD Ryzen 9000 series, AMD is hitting it out of the ball park. That paired with the issues Intel is currently experiencing for the Intel Core 13th/14th Gen CPUs and the ~400 benchmark results makes this a home run for AMD on the desktop side with only some minor Linux caveats.

entry.title: I spent a week using supermarket own-brand gaming peripherals, and suggest that you don’t
entry.summary: What if the company that sold your cheese also sold your PC gaming hardware? This is not the murmuring of some poor sod on a nineteen-hour Dota 2 binge who’s started thinking that the crumbs in his keyboard resemble a viable snack, but a bold new reality, one I recently found myself staring down during a trip to Asda. The supermarket chain – third biggest in the UK by turnover and purveyors of ill-fitting clothes and surprisingly good doughnuts alike – has added light-up gaming mice, keyboards, and headsets to its mountain of own-brand wares. Asda being what it is (Americans, if you’re unfamiliar, think Walmart with less gun violence), it’s all dirt cheap as well. £17 for a full-size keyboard. £16 for an FPS mouse. Overwhelmed with curiosity, I ended up taking home a complete starter set (keeb, different mouse, headset, and mousemat) for £45, or about a third of the price of the Logitech G515 Lightspeed TKL that I’d shortly kick off my desk. Could this be a new frontier in affordable PC hardware, bringing tech to the masses in a way no specialist retailer ever could, or should supermarkets stick to cereal and meal deals? Surely the Asda Tech (real name) 4-in-1 Gaming Kit would have the answers. Read more

entry.title: Thank Goodness You're Here! review: edges towards greatness and won't take you long to beat
entry.summary:
British comedy is too often defined by its relationship to America: either as merely irony and sarcasm, which we're told Americans don't understand, or as a sprightly ideas factory for works such as The Office, which Americans can bless by re-making at scale.
Peel back the curtains of American cultural hegemony however and you may find the true pulsing core of British comedy that lies beneath: innuendo. No American network is in a bidding war to import Vic and Bob or remake Bottom, and Carry On and Benny Hill are assumed to be anachronisms in our modern times, but Thank Goodness You're Here! enters the conversation with a nudge and a wink. It's a cheeky 2-3 hour adventure through a small northern town, and it's here to educate the entire world of our nation's obsession with sausages and bare bottoms.
